text:
e="preserve">Vincent Marzello (July 4, 1951 – March 31, 2020) was an American actor. He was born in New York City. He appeared on many movies such as "The Spy Who Loved Me", "Superman", "Never Say Never Again", "The Witches", "Taggart", "The House of Eliott", "The Fragile Heart", "Dalziel and Pascoe", "Little Britain", "Nuclear Secrets" and "Mile High". His best known role was as the voice of Farmer Pickles and Robert in "Bob the Builder".
In 2009, after being treated for cancer, Marzello was diagnosed with dementia. He died on March 31, 2020 in London, aged 68.
